page.title: 05CONSERVATION/WILDLIFE.WILDEN
page.content:
Around the area, very little old meadowland remains, apart from the old cricket field beside Manor Farm House. Wild flowers were found there which might not have survived in fertilized fields.A length of roadside verge in the area free from pesticide provides a natural habitat for unusual flowers too. It escapes regular verge cutting until after the flowers have bloomed.
{TREES }are of prime importance to both wildlife and the visual environment of the village landscape. Dutch Elm disease has taken a heavy toll. Some outstanding mature trees remain in the churchyard and Old Rectory,-home to a local colony of rooks. Another well-loved tree is the horse -chesnut in the school grounds. The leaf has been adopted as the school 'Logo.'
